job_title: Direct Care Worker in Meridian, MS
pros: There is always help wanted. DCW's and CNA's are the backbone and the foundation of the hospital.
cons: 1 year probation.  The pay is poor. The administartion and treatment team undermind what the DCW's are doing for the patients.  Some of the nurses are very condescending towards the DCW's and are more worried about there reputation than doing what is in the best interest of the patients.

job_title: Direct Care Worker in Meridian, MS
pros: It's highly accessible being thought it is not to hard to get hired with them. You get a pretty flexible schedule being as though you work 7 days within two weeks. Have a retirement savings that you put money into and can be retrieved when you resign or retire. If you do your 25 years with them they will match what it is you have saved up.
cons: Not much opportunity for advancement. Also very limited on modified scheduling. At one point in time they gave unlimited overtime now they don''t give it as often.

job_title: Revenue Cycle Director in Lauderdale, MS
pros: They promote an opportunity to advance oneself with education. The work is not hard as long as you do not let them know you are capable of more than what you were just hired to do
cons: Ability to receive promotions once hired are limited to those who forged personal relationships with the leadership. It's a great first time job for graduates but not so much for seasoned individuals

pros: You have paid holidays and some positions  have  weekends  off.
